quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Actress and Dirty Dancing
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, actor, theogony. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This actress is famous for playing Rhoda Morgenstern on the 1970s sitcom Rhoda.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Valerie Harper

questions.question: Canadian actor Alan Thicke portrayed the character of Coach Graham Lubbock, in the ABC television series Growing Pains.
In the sitcom Mork  Mindy, that ran on ABC from 1978 to 1982, which actress played Mindy McConnell?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pam Dawber

questions.question: Who played the wealthy and spoiled Blair Warner in the series The facts of Life, a show about the life at an all-girl boarding school in NY ?

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Janet DuBois

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Val Kilmer

questions.question: It is the son of Poseidon in the Olympian theogony, or of Oceanus and a Naiad. and the herdsman of Poseidons seals. He can foretell the future, but will change his shape to avoid having to. He will only answer to someone who is capable of capturing him.

options.text: Nobody puts Baby in a corner
Nobody loves Baby like I do

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nobody puts Baby in a corner

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Shirley Booth

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Nursery and Rhyme
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, humpty, construction. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Who were the three men in the nursery rhyme Rub a Dud Dub?

options.text: Rich man, Poor man and Baker

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Butcher, Candlestick Maker and Baker

questions.question: He was born and raised in a family of social-democrats and later helped found the Communist Party. In 1960 he became head of the National Defence Council, which gave him enough power to initiate the construction of the Wall, with Soviet permission of course.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Walter Ulbricht

questions.question: Even though the Soviets called it antifascist wall of protection, everybody knew it was not;  it was meant to keep Eastern Berliners in East Berlin. People from West Berlin could pass the border without any documents.

The Berlin Wall was one of the most modern and best guarded borders in the world. The list of obstacles that formed the Wall is quite terrifying. These safety measures made it almost impossible to pass the border without being seen (and killed). There were two concrete walls- one facing the Eastern side and one facing the Western. What was the color of the later one?
Aproximately 5000 East Germans escaped throughout the 28 long years.
How many bags of wool did the black sheep have in the nursery rhyme Baa Baa Black Sheep?
What does Jack jump over in the nursery rhyme Jack Be Nimble?

Just two days after construction of the Berlin Wall began, the first East Berliner escaped, jumping over the barbed fence. Some of the daring attempts to flee the Republic were really amazing; before the frontier barrier was fitted with vertical bars, nine people escaped from East Berlin in a small sports car, driving under the barrier. Do you know what kind of car it was?
What animal jumped over the moon in the nursery rhyme Hey Diddle Diddle?
In the original nursery rhyme Humpty Dumpty, Humpty couldnt be put together again.
In the nursery rhyme One, Two, Buckle My Shoe what do you do on Five, Six?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pick up sticks

questions.question: Rudolf Urban died on 19 August 1961, becoming the first one of the estimated 239 victims of the Wall. The last person was shot by the guards just two weeks before firing orders were withdrawn. What was his name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chris Gueffroy

questions.question: After 10 315 days in existence, the symbol of the Cold War came down. On 9 November 1989 East Germans could once again visit their relatives and beloved ones in West Berlin. But when was the Brandenburg Gate opened?

At first the wall was made of barbed wire and wire entanglements, but as time passed, it was strengthened to become a frightening concrete monster.  It was so enormous, it ran through 32 railway lines, 8 S-Bahn and 3 autobahns. How many streets did it cut through?
In the nursery rhyme This Little Piggy the middle piggy had baked ham.
